Case reference: 2014002517.CaseDesc: Hélène Laferrière was seen for the last time on November 4, 1976, in the Saint-Sacrement District in Quebec City, Quebec. Hélène has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006011299.CaseDesc: Henry Atlookan left Whiteclay Lake in a canoe to travel 55 km to Armstrong, Ontario. He may have been seen on June 25, 1968 making a purchase at a local store in the Town of Armstrong. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004526.CaseDesc: In 1999, Jesse Jurak was seen for the last time as he attended a family funeral in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2006013299.CaseDesc: Thomas Hesse was last seen on September 2, 1989 in Moonbeam Township, near Cochrane, Ontario.  He was riding a Raleigh, 3-speed, gold coloured, lady's bicycle.  Mr. Hesse left his parents' house in a depressed state and may have been suicidal.

Case reference: 2006020999.CaseDesc: Ivan Matthews was last seen when witnesses saw his sailboat out of control approximately one mile off shore near the Sand Islands in Lake Superior. It is presumed Mr. Matthews fell overboard.  He has not been seen since.

Deformity: Left Foot, club foot, sometimes uses crutches

Case reference: 2006012199.CaseDesc: Leonel Phillips left Butterfield Lodge by boat to travel on Lake Matinenda (Blind River, Ontario) to Log Chateau. Mr. Phillips' boat was located adrift but he was never found. He is presumed to have drowned.

Scar: Chest, A burn scar below his right breast

Case reference: 2014003349.CaseDesc: On March 14, 1993, Carl Berg Ellingsen was seen for the last time with his family at his residence in the East Vancouver region of British Columbia. Carl has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001288.CaseDesc: On November 9th, 1993, Violet Zarb was observed leaving her residence in Port Colborne, Ontario, shortly after 8:30 AM. Her vehicle was located on Clifton Hill, Niagara Falls, Ontario the next day.  Violet's whereabouts remain unknown to this date. At the time of her disappearance, Violet was possibly wearing a black leather jacket and blue jeans.

Case reference: 2012020054.CaseDesc: Glenn Colombe was last seen by his parents on June 28, 1989. At this time, he indicated to his parents he had a sore head which he said was the result of a fight he had been in earlier in the evening. He has not been seen since.

Hat: Cotton, White, philly flyers ball cap

Case reference: 2014030665.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1978, the partial remains of a female believed to be aged between 55-70 years of age, were found in the waters of the Salish Sea, southwest of Victoria, British Columbia. She had moderate arthritis and significant healed injuries to her left ankle and foot. It is believed she was deceased several months or even years before her remains were recovered

Case reference: 2012020003.CaseDesc: Kelly Rideout was reported missing to Chilliwack RCMP on August 28, 2011.  She is believed to have lived a high risk life style and her disappearance is suspicious.  Police believe that Miss Rideout was the victim of foul play.

Case reference: 2014005457.CaseDesc: On July 7, 2010, Roosdianajati and Didik Harijanto were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Roosdianajati and Didik were scheduled to work, but did not show up for their shifts.

Case reference: 2014005770.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1979, Thomas Lidguerre and Lawrence Sanger headed out from Fond du Lac to Uranium City on Lake Athabaska, Saskatchewan. The boat was located two days later, swamped near the Narrows and Popular Point. A search was conducted and lasted for over one month without any success in locating Thomas and Lawrence.

Case reference: 2014004703.CaseDesc: On August 13, 1995, Marie-Josée Boisjoli left her home in Laval, QC, mentioning that she was going to an appointment without giving any further details. The next day, her vehicle and personal belongings were found at the family cottage, located in the Gélinas Lake area in Mont-Tremblant. She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004992.CaseDesc: On October 12, 2004, at approximately 11:30 a.m., Kim Evans was seen for the last time at the North York Women’s Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Kim had said she was going to her family’s residence to collect her personal belongings.

Pierce: Nose, Nose ring on the right side

Case reference: 2020007369.CaseDesc: On October 14, 1981, at approximately 9:00pm, May Mah was last seen by her nurse in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016061153.CaseDesc: On April 20, 1996, a male was found on the shores of the Detroit River in the 800 block of Front Road North, Amherstburg. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 200 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He is described as balding, however, due to the length of time spent in the water, it is possible that his hair was lost after death giving the appearance of male pattern baldness. He is uncircumcised. His appendix is present. Changes to his heart suggest that he had high blood pressure and may have been treated for this. It is believed that he was in the water for days to weeks prior to his discovery.

Jewelry: Gold, Timex, watch with a gold-plated spandex band on his left wrist
Sweater: Black, Dark Blue, Knights of Round Table, polo
Scar: Forehead, 3.8 cm on the right side

Case reference: 2014001853.CaseDesc: On May 19, 1958, Clifford McKell and a friend were last seen having supper and told friends they were going out in the canoe. Neither of the men were considered experienced paddlers. No one witnessed the men leaving in the canoe. The following day they were reported missing by their employer when they failed to report to work. Police commenced an investigation and an air search found the overturned canoe. Paddles and safety cushions were also located. A witness who saw two men in a canoe around 8:30 pm indicated they were headed in a southerly direction and the lake was quite rough at the time. It is presumed Mr. McKell drowned.

Case reference: 2019015560.CaseDesc: On March 26, 2019, Donna Paré was reported missing in Montreal, Quebec. Donna last communicated with her family in December 2018, and is known to live a transient lifestyle. She is known to frequent the Berri-UQAM and Place-des-Arts metro stations, and the McDonald’s on Sainte-Catherine Street East and Berri Park in Montreal, Quebec. Donna’s family has reason to fear for her health and safety.

Case reference: 2012020661.CaseDesc: Darlene Anderson was last seen leaving the Hantleman Building at the Royal University Hospital in Saskatoon on November 6, 2006 at 8:00 pm.

Case reference: 2017029343.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2017, Patrick Wall was last seen at his home in Wetaskiwin County, Alberta. His abandoned vehicle was located in Edmonton, also in Alberta.

Case reference: 2007005499.CaseDesc: Lindsey Nicholls was 14 years old when she disappeared in 1993. She left the group home where she was living in the Comox Valley, BC at about 10:30 a.m. after having an argument with her foster mother. She was last seen walking away from the residence to visit some friends in Courtenay. She left all of her belongings and treasures in her room; she did not seem to be planning to run away.

Case reference: 2006013199.CaseDesc: Heather Moggy was last seen on June 22, 2002. She may be in the company of John Tucsok who has been affiliated with the "THE ASSEMBLY OF GOD" church. Mr. Tucsok is wanted by the police for offences in Ontario. Heather and John had a joint post office box together in Brantford, Ontario, until September 2003. A letter has been received post marked from Calgary, Alberta. The last contact from Heather Moggy to her family was by telephone, in October 2003, when she indicated that they may be going to Saskatchewan (Moose Jaw).  As of this date, all attempts to locate either subject have failed.

Case reference: 2008004499.CaseDesc: Paul Lanteigne was last seen on July 19, 1990. He telephoned his wife on July 20 to advise her he was leaving Cranberry Marina at 6:00 p.m. to return to the Dyconia Hotel in Wasaga Beach in his boat. The boat was recovered overturned in Georgian Bay, and a search was conducted. Grey deck shoes belonging to Mr. Lanteigne were found on the beach on July 21, 1990, but nothing else was recovered.

Case reference: 2018063238.CaseDesc: On January 20, 2001, Edward Pinarreto was seen for the last time when he left Toronto, Ontario, for a two-week vacation in Cuba. Edward was scheduled to return to Toronto on February 3, but never board his flight.

Case reference: 2014001826.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1960, Andrew Moses was last seen as he left his base camp on Brunswick Lake in Algoma County, Ontario. Andrew had left the base camp to check his trap line, which was approximately 5 miles in length near Ericson Creek. On November 13, 1960, a small search group was formed when Andrew did not return. The group located a rifle belonging to Andrew leaning against a tree. The following day, a half eaten beaver was located inside of a nearby camp on Ericson creek. The camp and trap line were searched one year later, and it revealed that it was vacant with no signs of being visited.

Case reference: 2014002445.CaseDesc: On April 9, 1998, Elaine Dumba was reported missing from Coquitlam, British Columbia. However, Ms. Dumba’s family have not seen or heard from her since April 9, 1989.

Case reference: 2014005549.CaseDesc: At the end of September, 2010, Dustin McMillan left Edmonton to drive to Ontario. Police have not been able to confirm where and when Dustin was last seen but he never made it to his final destination.

Case reference: 2014004911.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1974, Mr. Harper, his wife and their young child were out on the lake duck hunting and fishing. At one point in the day, the party stopped on shore to eat. During this stop, they noticed a storm coming in. By the time they left there were already waves forming as they started out across the lake. The wind increased and the waves were so strong that they would almost cause the vessel to flip over. The boat filled with water and a wave took Mr. Harper out of the boat. His wife and child drifted in the boat until they reached shore and were later rescued. No foul play is suspected in this matter and it is presumed Mr. Harper drowned.

Case reference: 2012020170.CaseDesc: An adult male was washed up along the south side of the beach at Stanley Park, near the 2000 block of Beach Avenue at English Bay in Vancouver.

Wallet: Black, Contained pliers and a jack knife
Mark: Forehead, Post mortem abrasion on the right side of the forehead

Case reference: 2012020055.CaseDesc:
The body of an Asian male was discovered by cleaning staff at the Northbrook Inn in Grand Rapids, Manitoba.  The individual had checked in at 15:30h after arriving on the bus from Winnipeg.  At 18:00h cleaning staff entered the room to find the occupant deceased in a chair.
It was learned that the subject checked into the hotel under the name "CHERON, Deoung".  A small black bag containing herbal medication was located in the room, which after translation from Korean revealed the prescription was issued to "PARK, Seng Dae"(variation of spelling PARK, Sang Dae).  It should be noted that the bus ticket-stub was located with the deceased identified "DUNG" as the individual who purchased the ticket.
Numerous checks were made with variety of agencies in an attempt to determine the man's identity.  It is believed he may be of Korean or Chinese decent.

Case reference: 2014003167.CaseDesc: Rufus Standingribbon was last seen in the month of October 1999 near Spirit River, Alberta. Mrs. Standingribbon did not notify anyone that he was going to be leaving the area as he normally did.

Case reference: 2014002595.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1997, John Grabluk was seen for the last time at the Scarborough Postal Union Office in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, John had taken a leave of absence.

Case reference: 2022055316.CaseDesc: Jesse Strongarm was last seen in December 2021 in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. At the time of this disappearance, Jesse was living a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2016006283.CaseDesc: Larry LEGACY was reported missing on March 22, 1993 when friends and family had not heard from him in several weeks. He was last known to reside in Edmonton, Alberta, but also frequented the Round Hill area, southeast of Edmonton. He also frequently traveled to Calgary, Alberta and to British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014002963.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1990, Nicholas Leonard was seen for the last time rowing a homemade kayak towards the north end of Lower Loon Lake in the town of Wabush, Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2014002002.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1977, Gaetan Pichette was seen for the last time in the Verdun district of Montreal, Quebec. His family and friends have not seen or heard from him since.

Tattoo: Right Arm, Arm tattoo, inscribed with "COCU"

Case reference: 2014046601.CaseDesc: Jason Beaupit has not been in contact with his family since September 2014. Mr. Beaupit was last seen on October 19, 2014, at a shelter in downtown Edmonton. He is known to travel and camp throughout British Columbia and Alberta.

Case reference: 2005002599.CaseDesc: On October 21, 1989, an unidentified man was discovered in the area of County Road 14 in Napanee, Ontario.  Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts that this man was of south Asian ancestry.

Shirt: White, DRESS, Brand: Pierre Cardin; grey, blue, and red thin stripes

Case reference: 2016066833.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1982, an unidentified male was discovered in the Detroit River, near Fighting Island. His post-mortem length was estimated as being between 5'6"-5'8",  however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he was in the water for no more than 6 months.

Jacket: Parka or hooded jacket, which had both a zipper and snap fasteners

Case reference: 2014001538.CaseDesc: During the month of March, 1998, Theresa Johnny was seen for the last time in Whitehorse, Yukon. The last known contact with Theresa was on July 18, 1998, with the Anchorage Police Department in Alaska, United States. Over the years, there have been a number of unconfirmed tips received about Theresa’s location and well being.

Case reference: 2014005713.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1980, Michael Konopekly was seen for the last time when he went fishing on Pallet Lake, near Cochrane, Ontario. Mr. Konopekly’s canoe, paddle and fishing rod were located at the lake, but Mr. Konopekly was not located.

Case reference: 2015018154.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1966, Delores Whiteman was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2023005753.CaseDesc: On January 1,1970, Anne Moran was last seen by her husband in their residence in Toronto, Ontario.  It was believed by her family that her husband reported her missing however no report can be located.  Her husband has since passed away.

Case reference: 2014003230.CaseDesc: Mr. James McGrath was reported missing on May 31, 2001, by family members.  At the time of his disappearance he was residing near Patrick's Cove, NL.  Mr. McGrath lived alone, and was last seen walking on the roadway approximately seven days before his disappearance.

Case reference: 2006004799.CaseDesc: Ralph Monague and Curtis Smith were passengers on the Christian Island Ferry travelling between Cedar Point and Christian Island on December 22, 1985, when they fell over board in stormy conditions.

Case reference: 2012020654.CaseDesc: On May 12, 1997, Darold Kishayinew was last seen at a relative’s house in Regina, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2006002199.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1994, this Caucasian male, was found in a field on the south side of the Rogers Centre (formerly known as the SkyDome) at the far end of Rees Street in Toronto. His post-mortem length was approximately 6’2" and he weighed 162lbs, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: Missing several teeth; had a great deal of restorative work done in the past with multiple silver-amalgam restorations

Case reference: 2014004563.CaseDesc: Brian Nadeau and David Pushor were last seen on November 25, 2004 travelling together in a 1983 Honda Civic near Fort Assiniboine, Alberta. The vehicle was later recovered from the Athabasca river where Highway 661 crosses via an ice bridge in the winter. Mr. Nadeau and Mr. Pushor were not located.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Text "Love is kind, 69er, Devil"

Case reference: 2016061228.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1970, a male was found floating in Lake Ontario near the mouth of the Humber River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 201lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to several days.

Shoes: Black, only the left shoe has laces

Case reference: 2014006380.CaseDesc: Dean Kelly Morrison was last seen October 23, 2013, after being dismissed from his job. His vehicle was left abandoned on a ranch.

Case reference: 2014002814.CaseDesc: On December 17, 1983, Guy Turgeon was seen for the last time when he left his home in the Rosemont-La-Petite-Patrie District in Montreal, Quebec. He was despondent and suffered from mental health issues. Guy hasn’t been seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2006006399.CaseDesc: Gerald Joseph Bouchard was last seen on the morning of June 4, 1998, in the Town of Moosonee, Ontario. Moosonee is a remote Northern Ontario community situated on the coast of James Bay. There are no roads to Moosonee and access is by rail or aircraft. It is believed that Mr. Bouchard may have left Moosonee by jumping on a rail boxcar.

Case reference: 2014001178.CaseDesc: The body of this adult male was found floating in the Fraser River near Prince George, British Columbia, on July 10, 1967. He wore upper dentures and it is believed he was in the water seven to ten days.

Pants: Blue, Suit Style, Dress pants with large metal buttons
Shoes: Black, Oxford, Pointed Shoes, size 7 or 8

Case reference: 2014002651.CaseDesc: Mabel Leo was last seen leaving a party near Nairn Falls, Pemberton, BC, in 1969, and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001474.CaseDesc: Pamela was last seen at her apartment complex on Lloyd Street in the city of Greater Sudbury, Ontario, in December of 1978.  She had left her son with her neighbour, and never returned. Her family had been expecting her to visit over the Christmas holidays, but she never went. When the family began trying to find her, they found that she had been missing for some time. She had left all her identification and personal belongings behind.

Case reference: 2005004699.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1995, an unidentified woman was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist Dock. She had adenomyosis, similar to endometriosis. She had peach/pink polish on finger and toe nails. She is estimated to have been in the water for a few days.

Teeth: Good condition with a few white fillings. Both lower first molars were extracted before death.
Jeans: Denim, Blue, Levi's Strauss, size 27 waist and 22 inseam
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, wearing a 14" chain with crucifix; European 9K gold; manufacturing mark of "ATS"
Scar: Abdomen, 12 cm surgical scar below the naval

Case reference: 2005000899.CaseDesc: On April 21, 2005, a Caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 29 and 50, was found in a wooded area on the embankment of a small creek off Queen Street in Bobcaygeon, Ontario. There are indications that this person suffered from early age-related osteoarthritis. It is believed that this individual had likely been at this location since 1994 or earlier.

Case reference: 2014005499.CaseDesc: During the early morning hours of Friday, October 1st, 2010, Janice Cher Desjarlais and her boyfriend crawled into a dumpster located behind The Center of Hope on Franklin Avenue in Fort McMurray. Janice's boyfriend advised that he left at approximately 7:30 a.m. to go to McDonald’s restaurant. When he returned at around 8:30 a.m., Janice was gone. When he was unable to find her, he suspected that the dumpster may have been emptied during his absence. On October 3rd, video surveillance of the area confirmed that the dumpster had been picked up at 8:22 a.m. on October 1st. It also showed the departure of Janice's boyfriend, but no one else entering or leaving the dumpster. On October 5th, a major excavation of the landfill was started, but by the time the search was completed on October 14th, Janice had not been located.

Case reference: 2014006454.CaseDesc: Jonathan Jay Wood was last seen in November 2013, in Abbotsford, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014006235.CaseDesc: A lake freighter capsized in a violent storm on Lake Winnipeg, just north of Hecla Island, Manitoba. The vessel carried nine crew members and one passenger. There was only one survivor who managed to float on a piece of the wreckage to safety. All of the bodies of the remaining occupants were recovered with the exception of Allan Clemens and Tache Everett who were never located. Autopsies confirmed that the causes of death for those recovered were either drowning or death due to exposure in the cold water. Mr. Clemens and Mr. Everett are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2011003099.CaseDesc: Brian Dunlop was dropped off in the downtown area of North Bay, Ontario by his father on the morning of June 2, 1994.  His family has not been in contact with him since that time.  In August of 1994, Brian was seen in North Bay and Oshawa, Ontario by people who knew him. This is the last time he was seen by anyone.

Case reference: 2006016399.CaseDesc: Noriharu Amano was last seen on July 24, 2005 at the airport on Airport Road in Sault Ste. Marie. He left in a Cessna C-172 aircraft which had white wings with red tips, a red fuselage with white stripe and white underside. Top of engine cowling was red. The Cessna was last heard from as it was circling over Goulais Bay.

Case reference: 2016069642.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1995, the remains of a woman were discovered near Carbon, Alberta. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 10 and 15 years. The individual had dental restorations including stainless steel crowns.

Case reference: 2014003086.CaseDesc: On January 30, 1997, Maurizio Di Caprio was last seen in Montreal. He left for Chicoutimi or Toronto to bring a vehicle back to Montreal.

Case reference: 2013000140.CaseDesc: On June 1, 1981, Rene Laflamme was last seen in Montreal, Quebec. René had visited his mother in Ottawa, Ontario and had left her residence to travel back to Montreal.

Case reference: 2014005809.CaseDesc: On June 8, 2012, Martha Kelly was last seen walking near her residence in Perth Andover, New-Brunswick. Martha suffered a brain injury in the past, leaving her at times with short term memory problems. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2016000962.CaseDesc: On January 5, 2016, Felix Claveau was last seen when he jumped off the Viau Bridge into the Rivière-des-Prairies in Laval, Quebec. Felix hasn’t been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003729.CaseDesc: On April 6, 1997, Céline Mercier was seen for the last time at her home in Levis, Quebec. Her vehicle was recovered near the Pierre-Laporte Bridge, which spans the cities of Levis and Quebec. Céline hasn’t been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020029.CaseDesc: Julie Derouin was reported missing to Lethbridge Police in June of 1983. There have been no confirmed sightings of Julie since January 1, 1980. Police investigations continue.

Case reference: 2008000499.CaseDesc: Kimberley Ann Amero was last seen at her residence in Saint John, New Brunswick on September 3, 1985. There has been no contact with family or friends since.

Case reference: 2018056500.CaseDesc: On August 2 1997, Ronald Halpern was last seen leaving his residence to go to the Toronto International Airport. Ronald boarded a flight traveling to the Dominican Republic.

Case reference: 2014005000.CaseDesc: On August 10, 2004, Mr. Lathlin was reported missing to police by his wife. She indicated to police the last time she saw Mr. Lathlin was on June 14th at which time he was leaving for Winnipeg from The Pas for a medical appointment on the 15th. He did not take any clothing and only took personal grooming items. Mr. Lathlin later called advising his wife he would be staying in Winnipeg as he had another appointment on Thursday. He again called his wife on Saturday morning asking for money. His wife sent the money as requested, however by Tuesday it was not claimed and it was returned to her. Mr. Lathlin has a history of living on the streets and has ties to Edmonton where he spent years on the street there. He also has various medical concerns. It is believed that Mr. Lathlin is likely in Winnipeg of his own volition. Mr. Lathlin's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2019043440.CaseDesc: On August 1, 2019, Victor Cuthand was reported missing from the City of Brockville, Ontario. Victor’s last known whereabouts were at a shelter located in downtown Toronto, Ontario, as of March, 2020. This was also the last time that Victor had communicated with his family.

Case reference: 2014005786.CaseDesc: Giuseppe Renda was last seen on May 4, 2012, at approximately 12:30 p.m., on Saint-Viateur Street West in the Plateau Mont-Royal borough of Montreal, Quebec. Giuseppe lived in the Westmount District, and was a discreet man who did not leave his home often.

Case reference: 2014006098.CaseDesc: On March 12, 2012, Mr. Ménard left Quebec to travel to Mexico by car with his dog. When returning home on March 14, 2013, he was denied entry to the United States at the US Customs in Nuevo Laredo because his dog was carrying ticks. Therefore, he stayed in Mexico and has not been seen since. His vehicle and his dog were recovered after having been stolen. The individuals interviewed for the vehicle theft provided no information into Mr. Ménard's disappearance.

Case reference: 2014006142.CaseDesc: On May 23, 2013, at approximately 6:30 a.m., John Lioudakis was seen for the last time at the Toronto Pearson International Airport, in Toronto, Ontario. John flew to Mexico and was scheduled to return on May 31, 2013, but he never boarded the flight.

Tattoo: Left Ankle, On calf; unknown animal

Case reference: 2014004887.CaseDesc: On October 10, 2005, Ghassem Sabeiri Gilchalan was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2001002010.CaseDesc: Stephanie Cyr was last seen on June 5, 1998 at her home in Saint-Basile, New Brunswick.

Jacket: Green, orange and yellow plaid jacket
Skirt: Black and white stripped velvet skirt.

Case reference: 2014004367.CaseDesc: Kendall Sumner has gone away in the past without notifying anyone, however for him to be away this long is completely out of character.

Case reference: 2006009799.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1974, Francis Foster, Robert Warren and another friend departed for a canoe trip on Basswood Lake, Quetico Park, 45 miles (72 km) south of Atikokan, Ontario. It is believed that the canoe overturned and all three are presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014003978.CaseDesc: Ernest Robert Pfaff left home at approximately 8pm on December 31, 1973 to purchase a loaf of bread.  He was driving a 1972 Ford Maverick, light blue in colour, with red pin stripes on the sides.

Case reference: 2012020007.CaseDesc: Nicole Hoar was tree planting in the Prince George, BC area.  She was last seen at a gas station on Highway 16 on the outskirts of Prince George, BC.  She was hitchhiking from Prince George to Smithers.

Backpack: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Black, Mountain Equipment Coop
Glasses: Bronze, octagon shaped, wire rimmed, prescription
Shoes: Black, sandals; velcro straps; size 9; navy blue, grey and black swirls

Case reference: 2014002868.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1989, Ronald Jack last spoke with his mother. During that telephone discussion, Ronald had informed her that he and his wife, Doreen Jack, would be leaving for a “camp job”. He had also said that they would be gone for approximately 10 days, and would be back before their sons, Russell and Ryan Jack, started their school year in September.

Case reference: 2014008479.CaseDesc: On May 2, 2014 William Grange was on vacation at the Cambridge Beach Resort and Spa in Bermuda. In the evening, he walked away from the resort.

Jewelry: Gold, wedding band with one diamond
Scar: Unknown, Small white scar, approx. 3" long, on top of hand, unknown right or left hand
Left Side Of Head, Surgical scar on left side of head/scalp from brain surgery

Case reference: 2014005984.CaseDesc: In 1972, Patricia Salamandyk was seen for the last time as she got off of the school bus with her sister in Spruce Grove, Parkland County, in Alberta. Patricia had told her sister that she was not going to school that day, and she has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2005002199.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1980, a Caucasian male was found at a campsite (Lot 19, Con 8, Peck Township) on Hardwood Lookout Trail in Algonquin Park. The death is estimated to have occurred between July 1, 1971 and Spring 1978.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Possibly in a ponytail
Belt: 36 inch, wear shown at 32 inch hole
Other: A folding camp stove; and an aluminum camper's pot with a lid
A black down-filled sleeping bag with a nylon outer shell
Wallet: Black, with 8 cent stamp issues between July 1, 1971 and September 1, 1976

Case reference: 2014006708.CaseDesc: On April 22nd, 2014 Andrew George Nicoll was reported missing from his home near Breton, Alberta. He was last seen on April 20, 2014. Extensive searches of his property and the surrounding county were conducted by ground and air. Mr. Nicoll has not been located.

Case reference: 2006020399.CaseDesc: Lawrence Prettie was last seen on October 23, 1994. His boat capsized on Lac Seul and he is presumed drowned. His body has never been recovered.  His boat, camping and fishing gear were located strewn about on an island in Lac Seul.

Case reference: 2017015824.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2017, Hua Guo was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002350.CaseDesc: On May 29th, 1990 Pierre Beaudoin left his residence in Hebron, Prince Edward Island. Police later confirmed that Mr. Beaudoin stayed at the Hotel Francis in New Richmond, Quebec and was seen for the last time on May 31, 1990, when he checked out of the hotel. Pierre’s truck and personal belongings were found in a dense, wooded area approximately 45 miles southeast of Route 275 in Balmoral, New Brunswick on August 17th, 1990.

Case reference: 2006008199.CaseDesc: Harley Metherel telephoned home from Vancouver on December 24, 1980, requesting a money transfer. Money was sent to him, but he never picked it up, and he has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001102.CaseDesc: On March 4, 1973, the remains of a young adult man were recovered from the Burrard Inlet in Vancouver, British Columbia. He carried a Canada flag pocket knife and is believed to have been in the water for several months prior to the discovery.

Case reference: 2013000027.CaseDesc: Nancy Joanne Forbes has not been seen or heard from since November 7, 2006. She was last seen at a bus stop on her way to a job interview in the Burnside Industrial Park in Dartmouth NS.

Case reference: 2012020077.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1986, Alexander Wiwchar, 72 years old, was last seen at 2:00 p.m. in Yorkton, SK. Mr. Wiwchar, who lived on a farm near Canora, SK, was seen at the Yorkton Bus Depot. Mr. Wiwchar is believed to have had some medical concerns and was suspected of having Alzheimer’s disease. His destination was unknown and he has not been seen or located since.

Mark: Chest, 9th rib fractured on the right side

Case reference: 2016013379.CaseDesc: On March 16, 2016, at approximately 4:00 a.m., Gilberto Cardinal-Fernandes was seen for the last time when he left his apartment to go for a walk in Gatineau, Quebec. Gilberto left without taking any of his personal belongings, and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Brown, Shoulder, Worn in long Dreadlocks, long brown beard
